articles.headline: Pardon Plea by Adolf Eichmann, Nazi War Criminal, Is Made Public
articles.snippet: Israel released the handwritten letter by Mr. Eichmann in which he denies guilt, saying Nazi officials like him were “mere instruments in the hands of leaders.”
articles.abstract: Israel released the handwritten letter by Mr. Eichmann in which he denies guilt, saying Nazi officials like him were “mere instruments in the hands of leaders.”
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — After he was convicted and sentenced to death in Israel for his role in the annihilation of millions of Jews by Nazi Germany, Adolf Eichmann pleaded for his own life.

articles.headline: 3 More Arrests in Oregon as Protest Leader Says ‘Go Home’
articles.snippet: Mr. Bundy, the protest leader, asked remaining occupiers at an Oregon wildlife refuge to “please stand down.” The F.B.I. later said three had surrendered.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bundy, the protest leader, asked remaining occupiers at an Oregon wildlife refuge to “please stand down.” The F.B.I. later said three had surrendered.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, Ore. — The armed occupation of a wildlife refuge in eastern Oregon, which flashed into violent confrontation with law enforcement on Tuesday when eight members of the group were arrested and one was killed, appeared to be unraveling on Wednesday night when the jailed leader of the siege advised his followers to go home.
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz, Dave Seminara and Kirk Johnson

articles.headline: F.C.C. Proposes Changes in Cable Set-Top Box Market
articles.snippet: The Federal Communications Commission wants to make it easier for subscribers to choose TV devices, and for manufacturers to introduce them.
articles.abstract: The Federal Communications Commission wants to make it easier for subscribers to choose TV devices, and for manufacturers to introduce them.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The cable set-top box, long a scourge of consumers and a moneymaker for cable companies, appears set for a makeover.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Emily Steel

articles.headline: A January Pause, but Fed Affirms Plan for Gradual Rate Increases
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve, which raised its benchmark interest rate last month for the first time in years, acknowledged weak global growth but said it still expected to increase rates.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve, which raised its benchmark interest rate last month for the first time in years, acknowledged weak global growth but said it still expected to increase rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve entered 2016 with a fairly straightforward plan to gradually increase its benchmark interest rate so long as job growth remained strong.

articles.headline: Wounded Warrior Project Spends Lavishly on Itself, Insiders Say
articles.snippet: The charity, which raised $372 million in 2015, has embraced aggressive styles of fund-raising, marketing and management — and has spent a significant proportion on overhead.
articles.abstract: The charity, which raised $372 million in 2015, has embraced aggressive styles of fund-raising, marketing and management — and has spent a significant proportion on overhead.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — In 2014, after 10 years of rapid growth, the Wounded Warrior Project flew its roughly 500 employees to Colorado Springs for an “all hands” meeting at the five-star Broadmoor hotel.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia Keeps Pumping Oil, Despite Financial and Political Risks
articles.snippet: Even as petroleum prices plummet and the kingdom burns through its financial reserves, the Saudis are betting they can win an oil war of attrition.
articles.abstract: Even as petroleum prices plummet and the kingdom burns through its financial reserves, the Saudis are betting they can win an oil war of attrition.

articles.headline: With No Détente, Donald Trump’s Feud With Fox Takes Center Stage
articles.snippet: With Mr. Trump declaring he will skip Thursday’s debate, the most potentially consequential fight is no longer between him and his fellow Republican candidates.
articles.abstract: With Mr. Trump declaring he will skip Thursday’s debate, the most potentially consequential fight is no longer between him and his fellow Republican candidates.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, Donald J. Trump had kept up a relentless and sometimes personal barrage against the Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly, in retaliation for the tough — and, he said, unfair — questioning she submitted him to in the first Republican debate last summer. And for months, Fox News and Ms. Kelly had avoided taking the bait, intent on sticking to Ms. Kelly’s vow to avoid becoming part of the story.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg, Maggie Haberman and John Koblin

articles.headline: Barbie Adds Curvy and Tall to Body Shapes
articles.snippet: Mattel has unveiled curvy, petite and tall versions of its fashion doll whose unrealistically thin shape has drawn criticism for decades. Sales have plunged as Barbie has struggled to remain relevant.
articles.abstract: Mattel has unveiled curvy, petite and tall versions of its fashion doll whose unrealistically thin shape has drawn criticism for decades. Sales have plunged as Barbie has struggled to remain relevant.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it comes to Barbie’s body, it will no longer be one size fits all.
